meanings.definition: To place a golf ball on a tee before hitting it.
meanings.sent1: He was teeing up the golf ball carefully.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys teeing off at the golf course every weekend.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was teeing up acorns for a game of golf.
meanings.sent4: The sun was teeing up to shine brightly on the green.
meanings.sent5: Teeing the ball with precision, he took a powerful swing.

meanings.definition: To set up or prepare for an action or event.
meanings.sent1: They were teeing up the stage for the performance.
meanings.sent2: She is teeing up the project for success.
meanings.sent3: The cat was teeing up its nap spot on the cozy blanket.
meanings.sent4: The students were teeing up their minds for the upcoming exam.
meanings.sent5: Teeing up the decorations, they made the room festive.
